chapter: 1.6 In a Class of Their Own
subject: Std 7 English

mcq_questions.question: What is the central theme of 'In a Class of Their Own'?
How many students are there in the class?
What kind of class are the students proud of?
Who is the class teacher?
How do the students face punishments?
What do the students refuse to do?
Why were students often punished?
What quality does Mrs Desai appreciate most?
How did Mrs Desai react to the first unit test results?
What expression showed Mrs Desai’s sadness?
What did Mrs Desai want to feel about her class?
Who noticed the change in the teacher’s words?
What did the students decide to do after the test?
Who suggested helping weaker students?
What role did Niyati play?
Who were called Searchlights?
What was the Plan of Action?
Why was the plan kept secret initially?
How quickly did Mrs Desai notice changes?
What improvement did Mrs Desai notice?
What changed in students’ attitude?
How did the students feel after improvement?
What does the title mean?
What quality binds the class?
What kind of punishment did the class accept?
What behavior is discouraged?
What behavior is encouraged?
What does unity lead to?
What value does the story highlight?
What does Mrs Desai symbolize?
What role do strong students play?
What problem did the class face initially?
What solved their problem?
What does the story say about discipline?
What does the story promote?
What changed classroom behavior?
What makes the class special?
What emotion replaced fear?
What does the story teach about leadership?
What does the class value over punishment?
What does the story say about responsibility?
What motivates the students?
What does the story say about success?
What quality of students is admired?
What is the setting of the story?
What lesson is given to readers?
What does the story inspire?
What does the story discourage?
What is the tone of the story?
